page.title: 13A VILLAGE MUM'S DAY - 1
page.content: The bedroom is bright and the birds are lovely are lovely to listen to. The alarm hasn't gone off yet - it's nice to have 5 minutes to oneself. With a husband, 2 daughters (aged 8 & 5) and a large dog to look after I appreciate the first few peaceful minutes of the day. The alarm rings so it's straight to the bathroom and then the kettle is put on before I start my caretaking job at the village school. I open up all the classrooms and put the the rubbish out (it's Monday). I return home to my first cup of tea and take a cup to my husband who is going on a residential course for his firm today. The girls are coming downstairs now, sleepy eyed and slipperless, for their breafast of juice, cereal and toast. The blue school dresses are now put on, teeth and hair brushed (not with the same brush) the goldfish fed.
